meanings.definition: Working together in a joint effort.
meanings.sent1: The coactive team completed the project successfully.
meanings.sent2: The students had a coactive study session to prepare for the exam.
meanings.sent3: The coactive ducks waddled in unison around the pond.
meanings.sent4: Their coactive efforts intertwined like a dance of collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The image of the coactive ants carrying food together was inspiring.

meanings.definition: Having a mutual influence or effect.
meanings.sent1: The coactive relationship between the two variables was evident.
meanings.sent2: Their coactive decisions shaped the outcome of the project.
meanings.sent3: The coactive plants seemed to communicate through their growth.
meanings.sent4: The coactive music and emotions created a harmonious atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The coactive colors blended seamlessly on the canvas.

meanings.sent1: The coactive efforts of the team members led to success.
meanings.sent2: Their coactive behavior showed great teamwork.
meanings.sent3: The coactive gears in the machine worked smoothly together.
meanings.sent4: The coactive voices in the choir filled the room with harmony.
meanings.sent5: The coactive waves crashed against the shore in rhythm.
